sections.heading: Overview
content:
Angelo Acquista, MD, is the medical director of the New York City Mayor's
Office of Emergency Management. He served on Mayor Rudolph Giuliani's Task
Force on Bioterrorism and is senior medical adviser for City Council Speaker
Gifford Miller. He is the author of The Survival Guide: What to Do in an
Atomic, Biological, or Nuclear Emergency .

Acquista received his medical degree from New York University School of
Medicine. His postdoctoral training included an internship and residency in
medicine at Lenox Hill Hospital, along with a fellowship in pulmonary medicine
and intensive care. Acquista is affiliated Lenox Hill Hospital as an Attending
and Assistant Chief of the Intensive Care Unit, and is currently Chairman of
the Quality Assurance Committee at Lenox Hill Hospital. He has been in private
practice since 1986 and was a co-founder of Madison Medical in 1995. Acquista
is board certified in Internal Medicine and Pulmonary Medicine. He is also
certified by the Royal College of Surgeons as a Diplomate in Tropical
Medicine.
